abstract: Nokia, a leader in the early days of mobile phones, is making a last-ditch gamble with Microsoft to grab onto the booming smartphone market.
snippet: Nokia, a leader in the early days of mobile phones, is making a last-ditch gamble with Microsoft to grab onto the booming smartphone market.
lead_paragraph: LONDON  Nokia, the struggling world leader in mobile phones, said on Friday that it would discard its own cellphone operating system and begin using software made by Microsoft, in an alliance to shore up the halting efforts in smartphones of two market leaders.

headline.main: Together, Nokia and Microsoft Renew a Push in Smartphones
headline.print_headline: Together, Nokia and Microsoft Renew a Push in Smartphones
